dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American culture is dying. We have an unrelenting appetite for processed junk food, talentless pop stars like Riley Banks and recycled movie franchises like Transformers. The more we consume crap, the more we want crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think there will be a groundswell movement towards simplicity. People will start to listen to their most rudimentary needs-- they will crave mental, spiritual and physical nourishment. It's back to basics.

dialogues.text: Wow, a lot to chew on. Well, thanks for being with us today. You're great, come back any time. For more on this gloomy but interesting subject, look out for trend forecaster, Celeste Martin's new book "Shitegeist," on bookshelves Monday. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, wait, where's your wife? You guys are here like everyday together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...we're separated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Cool. I mean, bummer. But okay. I'll go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste and Beth wander amidst the modern art. They stop take in a Cindy Sherman photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so...grotesque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But kind of beautiful. In a grotesque way. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh, let's keep moving. Too many feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste and Beth wander to the wall and stare at a Damien Hirst collage.

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I need to say this and then I'll never bring it up again. I'm sorry I wigged on you guys the other night but I don't know what you're doing. I think it's stupid that you're not together. You are best friends and that's the hard part. Nothing else matters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste and Beth stand in silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, the reality is I love Jesse dearly but he doesn't have a checking account. Or dress shoes. The father of my children will have a car. But...Jesse will always be my best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay fine. I've said my peace. It's your life. But I definitely don't think he should be living in your guest house. I think you're kind of breaking his heart. Slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I show you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth suddenly pulls Celeste into a corner. With no art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She points to her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I looking at? 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a hair. On my NECK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ewww. Will you get that thing lasered off, please? What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't because it will pop up somewhere else where I can't keep my eye on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious? That's the craziest thing I've ever heard. It's not a turnip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trust me, I know my body. It's a cruel land mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well at least pluck it for Chrissake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should, at least before my wedding, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste grabs the hair and pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain) AHHHHHHHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A security guard heads for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry sir, my friend has a really strong emotional reaction to modern art.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fucking rude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had to be done. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The studio is beautifully, magically chaotic. There are large canvasses everywhere, paint rags, spray cans, commo household items turned into sculptures (buttons, clothesp hangers) and mobiles. Celeste walks in. Jesse is on a mattress on the floor, he's clearly been sitting there fo while. He is fist-deep in a huge bag of Cheetos and he's watching the 2008 Beijing Olympics on Tivo. He is watchin short feature about Olympian Matthias Steiner, a gold medalist in weight lifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...you're not working? Are you watching the Olympics? Again? And crying? Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse blows his nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, you really love that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matthias' wife died in a car accident last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, three years ago now but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he dedicated his gold medal to her. The human spirit is...unbreakable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is choked up, can barely speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh. Hey, did you finish that artwork for the Pop Form website?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh yeah, I'm almost done. I'm working on it. I think you'll really like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll like it more when I have it because I needed it yesterday, so... 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns off the television, takes a deep breath, wipe his eyes and recovers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste, can you sit down for a minute? I have something really important to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. Does it have something to do with the work you owe me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste sits. Jesse sits next to her. Again, he has tears his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how to tell you this but...I have a date tonight. I'm gonna start dating. People.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A date? Really? That is so great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is? You don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Don't cry. Good for you, Jess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't bother you? Wow, okay. Well, it's actually the Yogurt Girl. From Yoga Yurt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Yogurt Girl, huh. She's cute! But so young, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super young. Her body is all-time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, no need for that. But this is good! You gotta crawl before you walk. I mean she's definitely not gonna be wifey number two, right? Ha.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's just a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hugs him in an unconsciously patronizing way. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big move. I'm proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse looks confused and slightly hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I get up now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste gets up and is immediately fixated by his hair.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, Skillz kinda made me do it and from the get go, she was way into...what are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, nothing. Are you gonna wear your hair like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Oh. I don't know, is it weird?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not weird, just different from how it looks best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks over and starts messing with his hair as he continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, this is what we're doing right? We're getting divorced and we're friends and we're also dating people? That's what we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is satisfied with her work. She steps back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. Better. You'll be great. You don't even need to be great. Just be you. Take her somewhere nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call me after? 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is on a date with Yogurt girl. It's clear he's hasn been doing a lot of talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I was in school but then I dropped out because I really wanted to work in fashion but it's really hard to find a paid internship? So I went back to school and now I work at Yoga Yurt part time but I'm really looking to make money doing something I love? But I'm sure the universe is looking out for me and when the time is right, the right thing will come along, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste is in bed on the computer. She hears noise from t outside. She listens more intently and hears Jesse... and woman, giggling and talking loudly. Then, the studio door shuts. Is Yogurt Girl sleeping over? He wouldn't do that. Would he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, with the morning symphony. Celeste drinks coffee, breakfast, surfs the internet and flips through magazines This time, she's also listening to a song from Riley Bank new album. It's exactly what she thought it would be. Overproduced, auto-tuned and meaningless. She nods her he "yeah, I get it." She turns it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste can't stop herself from constantly looking over a the studio to see if Yogurt Girl is still in there. Final a sleeping Jesse stirs for a minute and changes position. is alone. Phew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste, Beth, Tucker and Jesse browse as a foursome for books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it? They told me it would be in new releases... 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste searches frantically for her book. She peeks arou corner at a very obscured aisle with a sign reading "More Releases." Three copies of her book, "Shitegeist" appear the very bottom row, barely visible. She is disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's what I call placement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She grabs a copy of her book and briskly walks back to th front of the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you probably shouldn't steal it. Even if it is yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste marches to the Oprah's Book Club table and swiftl replaces the center display book with her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't have the "O" on your cover, you can't do that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Tucker arrive and see the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you guys are...you're on Oprah's Book List?? That's so great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something catches Celeste's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some people are browsing my book. Guys, come with me to eavesdrop ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste, Tucker and Beth head off. Then:

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jesse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse turns to see VERONICA, 26, stunning and European.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hey. How are you? 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, good. You look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, you too. How's your clothes pin collage going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, but it's going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't give up. Your work is really unique. And beautiful. I hope that doesn't sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's means a lot, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They looks at each other for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I had so much fun...that night. I'm so sorry I didn't call you. My life is just...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a lot of fun too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is silence, as Beth, Celeste and Tucker arrive and stare at her. Who is this creature??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh sorry, Veronica, this is Beth and Tucker and Celeste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica notices Celeste's name on the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is your book? I read an excerpt online, it's really compelling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, thank you. That is so nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, nice to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you too. Take care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and leaves. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was uh...Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No story. Just this girl I met a while ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. She's pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste changes focus again and turns to a Border's emplo to loudly and unconvincingly act out "Interested Reader" other shoppers to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her like she's crazy and keeps walking. And s her friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse and Skillz are exiting a Bizmarkie concert, surroun by older hip-hop fans and young hipsters who weren't aliv when the Biz dropped his first album. They are trashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby youuuuuuuu, you got what I neeeeeed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you say he's just a friend, and you say he's just a friend....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby youuuuu.... Oh baby youuuuu....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse's iPhone rings. A very flirty picture of Celeste co up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no. Ignore for sure. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I just need to...(picks up) Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Nooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to Celeste) Uh huh. Okay. Okay. No, I'm not busy. (hangs up) Uh, I'm gonna go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, after the show it's the after party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an Ikea dresser that she needs me to "build."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skillz takes this in. He is impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. Really, cowboy? Are you guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you pal, I know what I'm know I'm doing. She just needed time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste is in a corner with a glass of wine and a HUGE ba nuts and bolts. She had a fight with a dresser and the dresser won. Jesse uses his key and enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in here! Fuck Sweden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh baby youuuuu....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was definitely easier to build the Brooklyn Bridge, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how hard can it be? It's a dresser, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is drunker than before and sitting where Celeste wa earlier. Crying, frustrated. He's covered in sawdust and and bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me!!! Do you think they intentionally pick a random piece of furniture to make totally unbuildable, just to fuck with you

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jesse and Celeste admire their "dresser" as they d wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking lay-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We reveal that they are looking at a small, mangled, Swed robot constructed from the nuts and bolts and wood panell that should have been the dresser. They both slide to the floor in satisfaction. They look at their "artwork." They laugh; they are pretty drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ruscha meets Basquiat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...meets Serra meets Corky from "Life Goes On."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's a vegan, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cherish. That is so cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a laugh. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste looks at him. She kisses him. He kisses back. It hotter. They fall back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste and Jesse are in bed. Celeste is asleep. Jesse wa up and gently kisses Celeste all over her face. This wake her up. She is hungover and confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste does not respond. She pops up out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should talk about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Whoa, we were drunk. What a bad idea. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be sorry. It was nice. And I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jess, I don't...come on, we were drunk, and the dresser and I thought...you're dating other people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only to...god, I'm so stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He realizes how pathetic it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You thought what? 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, clearly I wasn't thinking. Or I wouldn't have let it happen. Come on Jess, we're not getting back together, you didn't think...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste realizes he did think...Jesse is crushed. He gets and leaves. He turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, there's a guy that you can call, from Ikea, that will build you're dresser. You should call him. Hell, he'll probably fuck you too. I'm a fucking idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jess! No, I didn't..Jess!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste collapses back in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of Los Angeles hipsters file out of a yoga class. Everyone is sweaty and a little out of it. Celeste heads as she towels off. She heads towards the shoe cubby holes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste keeps walking briskly. PAUL, 35, short but handso tries to keep up with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little too loud) How was your practice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My practice?? It was...wait, what?...it was fine. (who is this guy?) 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see you in class a lot. You have a great warrior two. Are you single?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste puts on her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you really doing this right now? You're really doing this right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul realizes that his game is wack. Oh well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can't believe it either. I don't do this, it's just happening, I can't stop...it...what do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gonna jump right in there. Wow, Captain Conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul. Here's my card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bring cards to yoga??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you're really pretty. I'm not good at this. Help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He smiles nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she looks at the card.) A financial analyst. Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. It's not cool. Did you ever tell me what you did for a living?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a pause in conversation. Celeste continues to pu her shoes on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, will you? I'd love to know. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a trend forecaster. I forecast trends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul scoffs at the notion that this is a real career.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trend forecaster. Really? Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have reached the parking lot. Celeste turns to him w purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You traded in your Porsche for an Audi because the economy is tanking and you're afraid you'll lose your job soon. You bought a Samsung cell phone because you think it makes you seem more "business-oriented," unlike the iPhone which is for teenage girls. You go to yoga because you went to a sub Ivy League college, spent the last ten years working long weeks and drinking all weekend and you feel like it's time to do something "spiritual." Nice to meet you, (looks at the card) Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste walks away. Paul remains where he is, flummoxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste enters through her side gate. She has some Chines takeout in her hand. She heads for the studio. She sees t Jesse is not there. Neither is any of his shit. It's completely empty and sterile now. He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste is about to go on the road for work. She is on th phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just make sure the San Fran focus group has a little more diversity than last time. It was like a rave. Without drugs. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and pauses. Then dials again. 35.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, Jess, it's me. I'm getting on a plane but I'd really like to talk to you. I don't know what happened last night. Hope you're okay. Call me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Celeste having lunch with a group of eight teenage She asks questions, they share laughs, she engages with t She is good at this. She excuses herself to make a phone call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste watches CNN alone. She dials Jesse. It rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is mid-laugh and looks at his phone to see Celeste calling. He presses "Ignore." We see that he is sitting w a women. We reveal that it is: Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse smiles big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. It's me. Again. I miss you. Anyway, call me. Okay. Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up, takes a breath and then, to herself:

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I love you. I'm so sorry. I've always loved you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She chuckles. 36.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course. Stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Hey. You're back. I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste is in her home office, working on the Riley accou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I want to talk to you too. Where have you been?? It's been like two weeks. So much to lay down...like, did you know that pay- per-view porn is available in Cantonese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Like subtitles or dubbed? Wait, actually, I'm really close to your house right now. Can I come by for a minute? It's....important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste puts away groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I have to tell you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. Wait, you first. Are you gay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes a really deep breath. 37.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Um, you're not gonna believe this but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (playfully) Oh no, did you go on another date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste is still busy, putting away groceries. She is hal listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am having a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste opens the pantry and puts away cereal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With another person?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. With another person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste takes out cold cuts from the bag and opens the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um. What? Sorry, I'm confused. Wait, what? What the fuck? With whom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With Veronica.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Veronica?? What's a Veronica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You actually met her. That day at the book store. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh. But that's not even physically possible, that was two weeks ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the truth is, I slept with Veronica three months ago. It was just a one night thing. But she's pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste rearranges the fruit bowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Okay. Shit. Didn't know about that. But that's not important right now. This is not good. Alright. Okay. You and I are gonna deal with this. We will, we'll just have to. What do you need me to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't have to do anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you don't even know this person, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah I know her. I mean, I'm getting to know her. And I really want to make it work with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it work?? You slept with her once! What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've actually been seeing her, well, a lot, recently. And I think I really like her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what you're saying is you got a girl pregnant and now you think you like her because she's pregnant? Or...I'm really confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universe is fucking weird, Celeste. I slept with her months ago and never called her after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we started hanging recently and she told me she was pregnant with my child. I know it's crazy, but it just feels...right. It was like this really weird retroactive gift. I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you excuse me for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste gets up and walks slowly to the bathroom. She gen shuts the door. She looks around, not knowing what to do herself. She focuses on a crack in the wall, she looks cl and then grabs the wall, thinking she might faint. She silently begins to sob, mouth open, eyes shut tight. She collapses on the wall. She is in silent turmoil. Is this really happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse is sitting, waiting. He checks his cell phone. He h the toilet flush. A moment goes by. Celeste re-enters, having pulled it together. But her face is still wet with tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. I had something in my eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Look, I know this is so sudden. And so weird. I've been holding on to us, this idea of us, for so long. And I know you've wanted me to let go. So I'm sorry. You were right, we're friends. We will always be friends. And I need that now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesse gives Celeste a big, long hug.

dialogues.speaker: JESSE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait, you had something to tell me too. Sorry... 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste takes a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She forces a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste is on the computer. She drinks coffee. Scott peek in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste lets out a guffaw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just following Diddy Twitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't...know what that means.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Sean Comb's Twitter page. There's also a singing competition on television. It's called American Idol? Keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay saucy. You don't have to be so saucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just part of our job, so...ready for breaking news? Jesse is having a baby with some girl. Crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Wow. Did you even know he was seeing someone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's this girl he slept with once a couple of months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now he's "making it work" with her. Plane crash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to say. I am so sorry, Celeste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need, Scott, I'm totally fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I wasn't going to have his baby. So, good for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's great that you're so resolved about this but it's also okay for you to have feelings. It's very sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste pauses to consider this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Well, let me see...mmmm, nope, I'm fine. I promise. Not in love with him anymore. It kind of makes it easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott is not convinced. Celeste is still distracted by th computer.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god, Diddy's snowboarding for the first time in Mammoth! Amazing. I actually have a date tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...that's great. Who's the guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The yahoo who did Pop Form's taxes last quarter. He's been asking me out forever. Not the one, but it'll be nice to be admired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree, go be admired. Who knows, you may actually even simulate human emotion. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste, in workout clothes, is cleaning up her house maniacally. She is walking past her office. The Ikea robo she built with Jesse catches her attention for a moment. keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste and MAX, 38, handsome and clean cut, are sitting dinner. They have just ordered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My foot actually pronates. And my I.T. band is strained when I run, which really hurts. So Dr. Ozar recommended a foot specialist who made these customized orthotics for me and it's amazing how much better I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, actually I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH MY GOD. My ex is here. Oh god, oh no, we just made eye contact. Maybe he didn't see me. Wait, he did. He's coming over. Oh god, this is so awkward.(to Max) You should probably leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what? I don't think...really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just go.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is Matt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just here. Just eating. It's a date. I'm dating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. The puttanesca special is the thing to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to know. I ordered that.

dialogues.text: Who are you here with?

dialogues.text: Kobe-LeBron tonight, right?

dialogues.text: Yes. Epic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, man. Good to see you, C.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too. You too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cool. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste immediately scarfs down her salad which has just arrived. She's quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was that? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste stares at Jesse at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: CELESTE, (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Do you like bread?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bread? Um, yeah, I like bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool, cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence, once again.

dialogues.text: Celeste and Max wait for their cars at the valet stand. M car arrives. He pays the valet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was great! I'm free next Wednesday? Sushi?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, I don't think we should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, because of mercury poisoning? I think that's a myth. I go to this acupuncturist that... 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I think you may need some time. To get over, you know, your divorce. It took me a long time to start dating after mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you for your concern but I'm just fine. I guess you're just not a match for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, have a good night. Good luck.

dialogues.text: Max gets in his car and is gone. Celeste stands there, confused and alone. She shakes him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) Whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste is running...hard. It is a cacophony of street so around her: traffic, honking, speeding, Celeste listens t the Dirty Projectors "Stillness is the Move" on her iPod joyfully runs across the street.

dialogues.text: Celeste arrives to meet Beth. She is in full marathon gea She waves at Beth and enters, panting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi honey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, wow, you are really out of breath. Did you fucking run here?? From West Hollywood??

dialogues.text: Yeah I ran. Just started. It's really fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're soaking wet. Isn't that like 12 miles??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13.5 actually. I was just clearing my head, you know, keeping the endorphins up. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Celeste pants like she's about to collapse. She doubles o with her hands on her knees. She's in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Right. Sorry. Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, you are a sweat tsunami.

dialogues.text: Celeste gets up and there is an outline of Celeste's enti body in sunblock and sweat. They look at the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry. I know people who can get that out. Easily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I guess I'm getting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Dating's really great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, my first available delivery is Monday afternoon. Does that work for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's fine. If you can you just call my cell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's dumb, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Elegant??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so you're all set then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elegant??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks a lot. (to Celeste)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: BETH, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: Not one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please let me drive you home. I'm afraid you'll drown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 22. Skillz set me up. He's about to be a huge star. He's filming "20,000 B.C.?" It's the prequel to

dialogues.text: Um...it's actually regimen?

dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Scrabble. Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charming.

dialogues.text: The Riley Banks branding strategy meeting is under way. Slides are being shown, Scott is giving a presentation on design ideas. Celeste is distracted and on her Blackberry We see an INSERT of Celeste's Blackberry on Dictionary.co looking up "regime: a mode or system of rule or governmen

dialogues.text: Celeste? Do you wanna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she sings, like she's in a musical) I'm uncomfortable with daaaaaating. I don't like any of iiiiiit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he sings back) Trust meeeee. You will liiiiike hiiiim. Also, I love cooo-ooock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you pissed in your pants?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I waited seven hours. Three of them soaking in my own pee. But I finally got the shot of Ahmadinejad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That is incredible. I think he's smiling, maybe.

dialogues.text: He is. I think the piss stain running down my jeans made him laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the world will think you're brilliant. No one will ever know but me. 54.

dialogues.text: I was nominated for a Pulitzer. I didn't win.

dialogues.text: Well, the guy who won shit his pants, so...

dialogues.text: (looking at his watch) Oh my god, we missed our reservation. It was at 8:30. Should I call down and see if they can still take us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect.

dialogues.text: Nick and Celeste are kissing. It's passionate but tender. They stop and their foreheads rest against each other's a they take a deep breath. They speak in hushed tones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was really, really nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, yeah. So, what are you doing for the rest of your life?

dialogues.text: Making out with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhh.

dialogues.text: Almost where?? No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, ah, ahhhhhhhhh!
